Reviews.Title: Good entry level Android phone. Works great with Ting
Reviews.Author: E. Burke
Reviews.Content: This is my first Android phone (yes I know I'm way behind the times), and I purchased it so I could switch from Net10 to Ting ( [...] ) which requires a Sprint branded phone to use their service. If you have never heard of Ting, check them out because our bill for 2 Android phones is now lower than what we paid for just one of our Net10 phones per month.My wife and I have been using these phones for over a month and so far everything is great. The slider keyboard is much easier to use than an on screen keyboard. Battery strength is good, I can charge it every 3 days with mild usage however some games and apps will drain it pretty quickly.Internal memory is a bit on the small side (150meg). It comes with a 2gig SD card for storing pics and music, but most apps require being installed on Internal Memory (some can be moved to SD) so you are limited on the number of apps you can install at any given time.The biggest memory hogs are the Google Play/Store apps that can't be easily removed without breaking all your games/apps. You can uninstall the updates for Google Books (6meg) and other of the Google core apps to recover some space, but don't expect to be able to download and play a 25 meg game on this phone.The screen is clear and responsive to touch, 3G web browsing is fast and very cool if your moving from a 'dumb phone', and it has Voice Search built in for Google search and 'Speak your Destination' for the GPS navigation.Speaker phone is loud and clear enough for driving hands free even with the loud exhaust in my truck.The camera is a bit below average and does not like low light situations. There is no flash. It takes decent pics in bright light and video is also decent but far from HQ.Honestly the best thing about using this phone is the service provided by Ting. I average $39/mo total bill for 2 phones, if you have to call them for support you get an answer by the 3rd ring by a live person who actually knows what they are talking about, and their coverage area is everywhere that Sprint covers and I've never found a dead spot.If you are on a budget and looking for a cheap slider Android, this phone would be a great buy for you. If you've got money to burn I'm sure you could find something higher quality. Based on price this phone is a solid 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: A Fabulous Phone for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: K. A. Patterson
Reviews.Content: I needed a phone both for my kids and for myself.  I wanted something that I wouldn't mourn if lost, and something durable that would survive middle school, high school, and my purse.  This phone is it.Running Android, the phone lets you sign in to a Google account and download all your contact information.  You can also view calendar dates and emails.  But the phone doesn't come with a lot of memory, so basically no games.  Since this is supposed to be a phone only, I don't really care about the small amount of memory.  If you are looking for an entertainment device, this would probably not work for you.I use Ting as my cell phone provider.  I connect all three phone in the house with no problems; I even ported my old cell number without a glitch.Overall, if you are looking for a small, durable Android phone for not a lot of money, I recommend the Kyocera Milano.

Reviews.Title: I Didn't Like It
Reviews.Author: c. taylor
Reviews.Content: This phone sucks. Even with a memory card it still says low memory. It has had to have 3 hard resets since I got it. I am not happy at all.

Reviews.Title: My first cell  phone & I love it!
Reviews.Author: T Sloth "Treesloth"
Reviews.Content: So I'm 40 years old & this is my first cell phone ever (major late comer).  I think it's perfect for someone whose needs are simple- calling & texting.  Although I have a data plan, I don't really use this phone for that a lot.  I think it's tough to surf the web on such a small screen and I don't really need a phone for that.  I also bought this phone to set up with Ting, which I did with no problems at all.  This phone goes everywhere with me & I've never had any problems with the battery or charging or anything.  If you're looking for a simple, reliable phone with the option for a data plan if needed for emergency, then this is the phone for you.  But if you're looking for something more high tech, then you should get something more high tech.  For what I need, this phone is perfect and I love it.

Reviews.Title: Good For The Low End Smart Phone
Reviews.Author: Keith "MuzikMan" Hannaleck
Reviews.Content: I have never had a problem with in a over a year now. Easy to use and no frills if you are looking for a less complicated first even smart phone.

Reviews.Title: This is a great phone
Reviews.Author: catherine bethune
Reviews.Content: My daughter love the phone. This is a great phon. I brought this because her phone was broke and she love it

Reviews.Title: looked brand new
Reviews.Author: William C Peterik
Reviews.Content: Opened the box and the phone looked brand new. Great phone for someone who is behind a bit on the smart phone revolution. Works perfectly with Ting

Reviews.Title: Kyocera Milano Phone.
Reviews.Author: Brian Manahan
Reviews.Content: This phone is Very Inexpensive. Still, too much money for what you get.During set up the sound was distorted and cut out.The screen was unresponsive 1 time out of 5.The keyboard slides out unwanted, That's annoying.Think Yugo.

Reviews.Title: Worth 35$.
Reviews.Author: Caitlyn
Reviews.Content: This phone is a first generation touch screen, it's not very effective. Good as a temporary phone, but not at all for long term use. I have had it for less than a month and will be replacing it shortly.

Reviews.Title: Horrible just simply horrible
Reviews.Author: Jessie Fox
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone hoping it would be like having my Kyocera Rise I loved that phone and pretty much cried when it legitimately broke in half however the only good thing I can say about this phone is that it has the slide keybored I love so much.  I'm always having issues with the earphone jack, closing the slide keybored too fast causes the phone to shut off, it crashes when I use the youtube app and my facebook messenger app, the second I got it and updated youtube -and youtube alone mind you- it said it was low on storage and I can't even uninstall all these factory installed apps I do not use at all.  My older sister has the same phone and has similar problems though when she got the facebook app itself the phone kept crashing now suddenly neither of our phones work.  We can't get the touch screen to work, can't get the keybored to work, and it won't recognize a charger of any kind.  Do yourself a favor don't make the same mistake I made, don't get this phone.

Reviews.Title: Be careful who you buy a phone from
Reviews.Author: Jayne A. Ammar
Reviews.Content: I am writing a review of the seller here, and not necessarily the phone.  I have not used the phone because it is not supported by the service I have.  I think people should be aware that this phone is NOT supported by Ting, despite an earlier review that says they bought this phone to be used with Ting service.  I bought this from a just launched seller, and tried to return it because it was not as advertised.  He was rude, suspicious, and unprofessional, and refused to refund me as required by Amazon's A to Z guarantee.  Now I will have to file a claim against him through Amazon.  What a pain in the neck.  Just be careful when buying phones on Amazon from unverified or "just launched" sellers.  And do your homework before your purchase so you don'd have to deal with my headache.

Reviews.Title: horrible phone
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This phone worked great for about 1 month then it constantly went into a loop where it would try to boot and would never turn on.  Had to perform a factory hard re-boot to get it to even turn on which wiped out all of the data saved on the phone.  Save yourself some grief and frustration by not buying this phone.

ProductInfo.Features:
Affordable 3G-enabled Android-powered smartphone with 3-inch touchscreen and side-sliding QWERTY keyboard
3.2-MP camera/camcorder; Bluetooth stereo music; personal and corporate e-mail; microSD memory expansion
800 MHz processor; GPS for navigation and location services; Wireless-N Wi-Fi networking
Autofocus 3.2MP camera with camcorder
Up to 7.65 hours of talk time
ProductInfo.Name: Sprint Kyocera Milano Android Phone (No Contract)
